ygData.subject: helping out other-- was twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve never really had a lot of cool stuff to give away. But when I gave up my level 16 character to move to Drinal... I gave up all of my stuff to a friend
ygData.messageBody:
I've never really had a lot of cool stuff to give
away. But when I gave up my level 16 character to move
to Drinal... I gave up all of my stuff to a friend
that had just died and lost all their stuff due to
falling off the boat.<br><br>This was a BBC, a Silvery
War Axe 1h, lotsa bronze, a crafted bracer, and about
150 plat, etc.<br><br>I've finally settled down on my
favorite class: Druid. I'm sorta weak b/c I spent too much
on Str and not enough on Wisdom... but it's my
experience that makes me valuable (IMHO).<br><br>I've also
got about 20 or 30 characters. I've deleted very few
of them. Although level 30 is by FAR the highest
I've ever gotten. I typically run out on the character
at around level 5, although I've got many above 7
and three or so above 12, etc.<br><br>My point is,
everyone actually defines twinking differently. I've never
thought of coins as twinking till about 4 months ago. And
even so, I usually use it to buy spells. Some ppl
might think a level 12 character in Black Iron armor,
banded and Bronze is twink. Others have no problem with
that. <br><br>Helping out others-- and how it relates
to twinking... I don't know. I just have troubles
figuring that out. If someone hands you a set of lambent
when you're level 1 as a bard-- do you turn it down?
It'd just go to someone else if ya did
so....<br><br>etc.<br><br>shooman out
